means: 使气馁( unnerve的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Tony was unnerved by the uncanny familiarity of her face.
sentence.Network_cn: 怪异的是，她看起来竟有些面熟，这让托尼心慌意乱。

sentence.Network_en: The news about Dermot had unnerved me.
sentence.Network_cn: 关于德莫特的消息让我很担心。
他的沉默令我们心里发慌。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 社会工作专业英语词汇(U) ... unneighborly 不睦邻的 unnerved 气馁的 unobjectionable 不惹人讨厌的.

list.abs: unnerved traders frantically searched for an explanation , scouring the trade blotters for clues to the cause .慌乱的交易员疯狂地寻找答案，搜索交易纪录以便找到股市大跌成因的线索。
she found the whole interview rather unnerving ., 她觉得整个面试让人气馁.
Scramblers can often unnerve a better tennis player ., 抢球者经常会使一个更优秀的网球运动员紧张.
the unnerving sound of a catfight woke Charlotte from her nap .猫打架传来不安的声音，把夏绿蒂从小睡中吵醒。

entry.def: If you say that something unnerves you, you mean that it worries or troubles you.

example.ex: The news about Dermot had unnerved me...
example.tran: 关于德莫特的消息让我很担心。

example.ex: Tony was unnerved by the uncanny familiarity of her face.
example.tran: 托尼对她的样子异常熟悉，这很让他烦恼。

sentences.sentence: "the steeplejack, exhausted and unnerved, couldn't hold on to his dangerous perch much longer"

auth_sentence.content: She was unnerved by the glimmer of the headstones.
auth_sentence.res_content: She was unnerved by the glimmer of the headstones.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: She was unnerved by the glimmer of the headstones.

auth_sentence.content: Political tensions between Madrid and Catalonia have unnerved investors.
auth_sentence.res_content: Political tensions between Madrid and Catalonia have unnerved investors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Political tensions between Madrid and Catalonia have unnerved investors.

auth_sentence.content: Foreign investors are also unnerved by two recent tax proposals.
auth_sentence.res_content: Foreign investors are also unnerved by two recent tax proposals.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Foreign investors are also unnerved by two recent tax proposals.
